name: Brno
fun_fact: Fun fact: Brno is home to the Villa Tugendhat, a UNESCO World Heritage modernist masterpiece, and it's where Gregor Mendel discovered the laws of genetic inheritance while breeding pea plants in a monastery garden.

The beef is marinated in a creamy sauce made from pureed root vegetables, creating silky richness. The dollop of whipped cream on top isn't optional, it's tradition.

signature_drinks.name: Moravian Wine

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Moravia is the Czech Republic's premier wine region. Brno sits surrounded by vineyard-covered hills. Locals drink Moravian whites with dinner - crisp, mineral, food-friendly. The rolling hills around Brno produce some of Central Europe's best wines that rarely leave the region.

signature_drinks.name: Czech Pilsner
signature_drinks.description: The original pilsner-style beer - crisp, golden, hoppy perfection from nearby Pilsen
signature_drinks.how_local drink it: Beer is cheaper than water in Czech Republic. Served from tank (tankovna) at traditional pubs for ultimate freshness. Pilsner Urquell straight from the tank is religious experience. Locals drink it throughout meals and evenings at hospodas (pubs).
